Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy I Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Sex offender treatment.  Must comply with Sex offender registry. 
Agent would need to give prior approval for contact with anyone under age 18.  Agent prior approval needed for access to the internet.  Agent to give prior approval to live near a park, daycare or school.  
Provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: 01:33 PM Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Defendant Troy I Webster in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments as to what was considered at sentencing by Atty Petit.  Judge points out that the JOC should be amended to reflect 55 days of jail credit.  Atty Parker cites legal statutes.  Points out the accuracy of PSI should be raised at sentencing.  Exhibit #1 marked.  Judge doesn't see anything here that would have changed his mind.  Atty Petit will prepare an order.  Clerk will amend the JOC administratively.
It is ordered that the time for  the circuit court to decide the defendant's pending postconviction motion is extended to 3-8-19

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Defendant Troy I Webster in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense has 4 people wishing to make statements on behalf of defendant here in court today.  
SD sworn in and testifies about the defendant. JD sworn in and testifies about the defendant.  EP sworn in and testifies about the defendant.  EW sworn in and testifies about the defendant.  
PSI reviewed by DA Parker.  DA Parker makes recommendation for 4 yrs IC and 5 yrs ES with conditions.  Defense requests probation. 
Defendant given opportunity to address the court.  
Judge pronounces sentence:  No possession of firearms.  no voting while being punished for a felony
State prison:  4 yrs Initial confinement with 2 yrs ES. 54 days jail credit
Sex offender treatment.  Must comply with Sex offender registry. 
Agent would need to give prior approval for contact with anyone under age 18.  Agent prior approval needed for access to the internet.  Agent to give prior approval to live near a park, daycare or school.  
$500 plus costs.  Provide a DNA sample.  
Not eligible for CIP or SAP
Judge Habeck's response to Paige M. Webster's furlough request for Troy Webtster - DENIED

This is additional money to any already posted.  Conditions:  3rd party use of internet to purchase medication.  Defendant not to use internet.  No contact with anyone under 18 years old.  Defendant cannot leave state of WI. No unsupervised contact with child, defendants mother must be present.

Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI has been completed and reviewed.  Atty Musolf requesting a 4 week adjournment to allow an alternative PSI be completed.  Makes arguments as to why he believes adjournment should be granted.  Requests family members appear on his behalf.  DA Parker makes arguments.  Court makes a statement will adjourn however, bond will be changed.  Court amends bond to an additional $9,000 cash.  This is in addition to what is already posted.  Defendant wants counsel to withdraw and wants not to be placed into custody.  Defendant taken into custody on the increased bond amount.  
Administrative change of attorneys is possible if necessary.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 29, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Department of Correction wanting clarification about PSI

Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to an amended charge of Child Enticement 948.07(1).  A risk evaluation has been completed but no report filed.  No specific recommendations for sentencing.  Defendant agrees to a PSI and psycho-sexual evaluation.  If the evaluation is not completed, DA will void the amendment.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty as amended.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided.  Court orders a PSI and psycho-sexual evaluation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
ck #20038 part of bond to Attorney
Jury trial on August 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on February 14, 2017 at 11:15 am.
Review hearing on December 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Attny Musolf has letter indicating defendant scheduled for an evaluation on August 4th.  DA believes this report needs to be completed to determine if there are any NGI or other type issues.
Hearing Notice - hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remarks by Atty. Musolf regarding competency.  Evaluation was done, but report not dictated yet.  More tests to be completed yet by a neurologist.  Response by Atty. Parker.  Court makes its findings - wound want to see reports also.  Court explains to defendant about medical release forms.
next hearing notice hand delivered to defendant

Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense asks for another date.  Attorney Musolf trying to set up a conference call with defendant's doctor in the near future in regards to medical condition.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

This was the date set for a plea hearing.  Attny Musolf is requesting an adjournment to get some medical records and contact defendant's doctors.  Would like 2-4 wks to handle.  Already has release information from defendant.  Requests $1,500.00 be released for defendant's evaluation to Kevin Musolf's Trust Accout.  Court will allow release upon receipt of a signed statement from the surety indicating that was ok.

Defendant Troy I Webster in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA - DE to waive prelim.Atty Musold agrees, no written waiver.  Court reviews rights w/DE.  DE waives rights.  Court accepts waiver & binds the  matter over for trial.  Atty Musolf - arraignment to be set, requests modification of bond conditions: 1) to allow DE to travel outside Shawano/Menominee Counties. 2) to allow 3rd party use of Internet to purchase meds.  DA does not object, Court grants.  Atty Musolf requests relief from bond to allow DE to pick up/return relative to Minneapolis Airport.  DA requires Waiver of Extradition be filed w/itinerary.  Court grants.  Arraignment scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

3rd party use of internet to purchase medication
DE not to use internet
No Contact w/anyone under 18
No unsupervised contact w/child unless DE's mother is present.

Can leave Shawano County to see counsel in Outagamie County and medical appointments & work in Brown County.  No other travel outside Menominee or Shawano County without prior Court approval. No contact with anyone under 18 years old except no unsupervised contact with child in the home.  Defendant's mother must be present.

Defendant Troy I Webster in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Has spoken with Mary Lou Robinsin.  Requests a bond modification to leave county to see counsel in Outagamie County and also allowed in Brown County for medical appointments as well as work.  Defendant requests some of his personal items be returned and advises Court which ones.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with anyone under 18 years old, except no unsupervised contact with child in the home; defendant's mother must be present.  No travel outside Shawano or Menominee County without prior court approval; however he may enter Brown County only for purposes of employment.  
No possession or access of any device that can access the internet, including phones.

Defendant Troy I Webster appeared by video means with Attorney Haacke.   Prosecuting Atty Catharine D. White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
